remarks: The unit of a ring is an identity element for the multiplication. (Contributed by FL, 18-Feb-2010.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
uridm.1 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
uridm.2 $e |- X = ran ( 1st ` R ) $.
uridm.3 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
rngoidmlem $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ A e. X ) -> ( ( U H A ) = A /\ ( A H U ) = A ) ) $.
